me.buggin

Class Good

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.buggin.Good

  • public class Good
extends java.lang.Object
    Main object representing the good purchased

    Motivation for using BigDecimal :)

    From an article by Brian Goetz:

    "...it is a bad idea to use floating point to try to represent exact quantities like monetary amounts. Using floating point for dollars-and-cents calculations is a recipe for disaster. Floating point numbers are best reserved for values such as measurements, whose values are fundamentally inexact to begin with."

    Author:
    Alessandro Buggin

      round amount following specification: The rounding rules for sales tax are that for a tax rate of n%, a shelf price of p contains (np/100 rounded up to the nearest 0.05) amount of sales tax.
